function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website features Samsung Galaxy A Series phones such as A2 Core, A80, A70, A60, and A30. The products have 'add to cart' buttons for each phone, and there is a cart overlay for managing items in the cart.","new_testing_goal":"Add a new product 'Galaxy A70' to the cart and view the cart overlay to test cart functionality.","explanation":"Add the 'Galaxy A70' product to the cart. View the cart overlay to ensure the product was added correctly and check the cart functionality.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"10:r1l:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.

Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website showcases Samsung Galaxy A Series phones like A2 Core, A80, A70, A60, and A30. It has 'add to cart' buttons for each phone and a cart overlay for managing items in the cart.","new_testing_goal":"Add Galaxy A30, A60, and A80 to the cart to test cart functionality and proceed to the checkout process.","explanation":"Add the 'Galaxy A30', 'Galaxy A60', and 'Galaxy A80' products to the cart. Then, clear the cart and proceed to the checkout page for the existing product in the cart.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-a_series"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Clear the cart and proceed to the checkout page for the existing product in the cart..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Add a product 'Galaxy S10 5G' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Add a product 'Galaxy S10' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Add a product 'Galaxy S10e' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 2, "Add a product 'Galaxy A50' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 7, "Add a product 'Galaxy S10+' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Add a product 'Galaxy A80' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Clear the cart and proceed to the checkout page for the existing product in the cart.": 3, "Add a new product 'Galaxy A70' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Add a product 'Galaxy A2 Core' to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Add multiple products to the cart to test cart functionality and proceed to the checkout process.": 3, "Add Galaxy A30, A60, and A80 to the cart to test cart functionality and proceed to the checkout process.": 2}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: 5:r1l:, 9:r1l:, 10:r1l:, 11:r1l:, 12:r1l:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:. You cannot use the "click" action with the element id ":r6:" because it is not applicable.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
